R6 class for a dbi connection, see connector_dbi (used to interact with DBI compliant database backends)

connector_dbi.Rd

Connector object for DBI connections. This object is used to interact with DBI compliant database backends. See the DBI package for how which backends are supported.

Details

Upon garbage collection, the connection will try to disconnect from the database. But it is good practice to call disconnect when you are done with the connection.

Super class

connector::connector -> connector_dbi

Active bindings

conn

The DBI connector object of the connector

Methods

Public methods

  • connector_dbi$new()

  • connector_dbi$disconnect()

  • connector_dbi$tbl()

  • connector_dbi$clone()

Inherited methods
  • connector::connector$list_content()
  • connector::connector$read()
  • connector::connector$remove()
  • connector::connector$write()

Method new()

Initialize the connection

Usage

connector_dbi$new(drv, ...)

Arguments

drv

DBI driver

...

Additional arguments passed to DBI::dbConnect

Returns

A connector_dbi object

Method disconnect()

Disconnect from the database

Usage

connector_dbi$disconnect()

Method tbl()

Create a tbl object

Usage

connector_dbi$tbl(name, ...)

Arguments

name

character Table name

...

Additional arguments passed to dplyr::tbl

Method clone()

The objects of this class are cloneable with this method.

Usage

connector_dbi$clone(deep = FALSE)

Arguments

deep

Whether to make a deep clone.

Examples

# Create DBI connector

db <- connector_dbi$new(RSQLite::SQLite(), ":memory:")

db
#> <connector_dbi>
#>   Inherits from: <connector>
#>   Public:
#>     clone: function (deep = FALSE) 
#>     conn: active binding
#>     disconnect: function () 
#>     initialize: function (drv, ...) 
#>     list_content: function (...) 
#>     read: function (name, ...) 
#>     remove: function (name, ...) 
#>     tbl: function (name, ...) 
#>     write: function (x, name, ...) 
#>   Private:
#>     .conn: SQLiteConnection
#>     finalize: function () 

# Write to the database

db$write(iris, "iris")

# Read from the database

db$read("iris") |>
  head(5)
#>   Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width Species
#> 1          5.1         3.5          1.4         0.2  setosa
#> 2          4.9         3.0          1.4         0.2  setosa
#> 3          4.7         3.2          1.3         0.2  setosa
#> 4          4.6         3.1          1.5         0.2  setosa
#> 5          5.0         3.6          1.4         0.2  setosa

# List available tables

db$list_content()
#> [1] "iris"

# Use the connector to run a query

db$conn
#> <SQLiteConnection>
#>   Path: :memory:
#>   Extensions: TRUE

db$conn |>
  DBI::dbGetQuery("SELECT * FROM iris limit 5")
#>   Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width Species
#> 1          5.1         3.5          1.4         0.2  setosa
#> 2          4.9         3.0          1.4         0.2  setosa
#> 3          4.7         3.2          1.3         0.2  setosa
#> 4          4.6         3.1          1.5         0.2  setosa
#> 5          5.0         3.6          1.4         0.2  setosa

# Use dplyr verbs and collect data

db$tbl("iris") |>
  dplyr::filter(Sepal.Length > 7) |>
  dplyr::collect()
#> # A tibble: 12 × 5
#>    Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width Species  
#>           <dbl>       <dbl>        <dbl>       <dbl> <chr>    
#>  1          7.1         3            5.9         2.1 virginica
#>  2          7.6         3            6.6         2.1 virginica
#>  3          7.3         2.9          6.3         1.8 virginica
#>  4          7.2         3.6          6.1         2.5 virginica
#>  5          7.7         3.8          6.7         2.2 virginica
#>  6          7.7         2.6          6.9         2.3 virginica
#>  7          7.7         2.8          6.7         2   virginica
#>  8          7.2         3.2          6           1.8 virginica
#>  9          7.2         3            5.8         1.6 virginica
#> 10          7.4         2.8          6.1         1.9 virginica
#> 11          7.9         3.8          6.4         2   virginica
#> 12          7.7         3            6.1         2.3 virginica

# Disconnect from the database

db$disconnect()
